description: PLANNING APPLICATION FOR THE  REPLACEMENT OF  THE EXISTING, DOUBLE GLAZED WHITE TIMBER CASEMENT WINDOWS AND FRONT DOOR AS THE WINDOWSILLS HAVE ALL DELAMINATED. THE REPLACEMENTS WILL BE DOUBLE GLAZED, WHITE TIMBER CASEMENT WINDOWS TO THE SAME SPECIFICATION
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby perDrawing no: 2025 OS 100042766 (Site Location Plan) Dated 16-Mar-2025
Drawing no: Grabex Trade Quotation (Proposed Windows Doors, Glazing, Dimensions, TIMBER Flush Casement Frame Specification & frame details) Dated 16/03/2025: 
Drawing no: GRABEX (PROPOSED TIMBER CASEMENT WINDOWS, DOORS, SLIDING SYSTEMS, BI-FOLDS AND ROOFS) Dated 16/03/2025. 
Drawing no:GA03 (Existing and Proposed Front Elevation Plan And Proposed Rear Elevation Plan) Dated February 2024. 
Drawing no: G04 (Proposed Side Elevations Plan) Dated February 2024
Drawing no:DD04 (AS Existing WINDOW GW01 - Softwood), Window FW01, Window - FW03 - Softwood, Window FW04 -Softwood and Window FW05 - Softwood) Dated February 2024
mitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form and submitted Materials unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Obscured Glazing - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the first floor south side elevation shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved [without delay.

ii) The application was amended following negotiations with the Council to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

iii) The application was recommended for approval and referred to the first available Planning Committee, where the agents / applicants had an opportunity to present the application.
